name: Northern Screamer
description: The Northern Screamer is a large bird with a distinctive black and white plumage and a loud, piercing call.
spread_note: Found in northern Colombia and northwestern Venezuela.
food_note: Forages in shallow waters and muddy areas.
reproduction: Lays 3-5 eggs in a nest near water, incubation about 40 days.
attractions: Notable for their unique vocalizations, often featured in wetland exhibits.
projects_note: Limited conservation focus due to stable populations.
breeding: Rarely bred in captivity due to specific habitat needs.
